intro: Andinia platysepala, commonly known as the flat-sepal andinia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
